headline: Super Micro Computer, Booking Holdings, Qorvo: After-hours movers
summary: Here are some of the stocks moving in after-hours trading. Shares of Super Micro Computer (SMCI) are falling sharply after releasing disappointing preliminary third quarter results. Booking Holdings (BKNG) posted Q1 revenue that topped estimates, but the company's CEO warned of "uncertainty in the market." Qorvo (QRVO) shares jumped after posting fourth quarter results that were better than analysts had expected. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Booking (NASDAQ:BKNG) Surprises With Strong Q1
summary: Online travel agency Booking Holdings (NASDAQ:BKNG) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q1 CY2025, with sales up 7.9% year on year to $4.76 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $24.81 per share was 41.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Booking Holdings posts upbeat quarterly results helped by international travel
summary: This has also helped drive up the price of lodgings and travel services in the region.  However, U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs on imports have caused widespread worries of a recession, resulting in a pullback in consumer sentiment as well as in discretionary spending.  Booking posted an adjusted profit of $24.81 per share for the quarter ended March 31, compared with analysts' average estimate of $17.33 per share, according to data compiled by LSEG.

headline: Booking Stock Falls Despite Earnings Beat. Travel Firm Facing Market 'Uncertainty.'
summary: Booking Holdings stock slipped late Tuesday despite the online travel booking company reporting first-quarter earnings and sales that exceeded expectations.  The company also provided a stronger-than-expected sales forecast for the current quarter on a call with analysts.  Booking Holdings — parent company of Booking.com, Priceline and other brands — said it earned $24.81 per share on sales of $4.8 billion for the March-ended quarter.

headline: Booking Holdings (NasdaqGS:BKNG) Sees 10% Price Surge Over The Past Week
summary: Booking Holdings (NasdaqGS:BKNG) shares increased by 10% over the past week, a movement that coincided with broader market gains, as the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 extended their winning streaks to six days. Recent executive changes, including the announcement of Wei Hopeman's retirement from the board, might have added weight to the broader upward trend. Additionally, anticipation surrounding the upcoming Q1 2025 earnings report on April 29 could have influenced investor...
